prop.name: spouse
prop.desc: The person's spouse.

prop.name: funder
prop.desc: A person or organization that supports (sponsors) something through some kind of financial contribution.

prop.name: colleagues
prop.desc: A colleague of the person.

prop.name: deathDate
prop.desc: Date of death.

prop.name: memberOf
prop.desc: An Organization (or ProgramMembership) to which this Person or Organization belongs.

prop.name: height
prop.desc: The height of the item.

prop.name: workLocation
prop.desc: A contact location for a person's place of work.

prop.name: netWorth
prop.desc: The total financial value of the person as calculated by subtracting assets from liabilities.

prop.name: children
prop.desc: A child of the person.

prop.name: jobTitle
prop.desc: The job title of the person (for example, Financial Manager).

prop.name: hasOfferCatalog
prop.desc: Indicates an OfferCatalog listing for this Organization, Person, or Service.

prop.name: deathPlace
prop.desc: The place where the person died.

prop.name: globalLocationNumber
prop.desc: The Global Location Number (GLN, sometimes also referred to as International Location Number or ILN) of the respective organization, person, or place. The GLN is a 13-digit number used to identify parties and physical locations.

prop.name: birthPlace
prop.desc: The place where the person was born.

prop.name: gender
prop.desc: Gender of the person. While http://schema.org/Male and http://schema.org/Female may be used, text strings are also acceptable for people who do not identify as a binary gender.

prop.name: alumniOf
prop.desc: An organization that the person is an alumni of.

prop.name: homeLocation
prop.desc: A contact location for a person's residence.

prop.name: duns
prop.desc: The Dun & Bradstreet DUNS number for identifying an organization or business person.

prop.name: taxID
prop.desc: The Tax / Fiscal ID of the organization or person, e.g. the TIN in the US or the CIF/NIF in Spain.

prop.name: award
prop.desc: An award won by or for this item.

prop.name: birthDate
prop.desc: Date of birth.

prop.name: makesOffer
prop.desc: A pointer to products or services offered by the organization or person.

prop.name: givenName
prop.desc: Given name. In the U.S., the first name of a Person. This can be used along with familyName instead of the name property.

prop.name: contactPoints
prop.desc: A contact point for a person or organization.

prop.name: awards
prop.desc: Awards won by or for this item.

prop.name: familyName
prop.desc: Family name. In the U.S., the last name of an Person. This can be used along with givenName instead of the name property.

prop.name: seeks
prop.desc: A pointer to products or services sought by the organization or person (demand).

prop.name: sibling
prop.desc: A sibling of the person.

prop.name: address
prop.desc: Physical address of the item.

prop.name: performerIn
prop.desc: Event that this person is a performer or participant in.

prop.name: honorificPrefix
prop.desc: An honorific prefix preceding a Person's name such as Dr/Mrs/Mr.

prop.name: additionalName
prop.desc: An additional name for a Person, can be used for a middle name.

prop.name: siblings
prop.desc: A sibling of the person.

prop.name: telephone
prop.desc: The telephone number.

prop.name: email
prop.desc: Email address.

prop.name: weight
prop.desc: The weight of the product or person.

prop.name: contactPoint
prop.desc: A contact point for a person or organization.

prop.name: colleague
prop.desc: A colleague of the person.

prop.name: parents
prop.desc: A parents of the person.

prop.name: naics
prop.desc: The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code for a particular organization or business person.

prop.name: hasPOS
prop.desc: Points-of-Sales operated by the organization or person.

prop.name: parent
prop.desc: A parent of this person.

prop.name: owns
prop.desc: Products owned by the organization or person.

prop.name: affiliation
prop.desc: An organization that this person is affiliated with. For example, a school/university, a club, or a team.

prop.name: publishingPrinciples
prop.desc:
The publishingPrinciples property indicates (typically via URL) a document describing the editorial principles of an Organization (or individual e.g. a Person writing a blog) that relate to their activities as a publisher, e.g. ethics or diversity policies. When applied to a CreativeWork (e.g. NewsArticle) the principles are those of the party primarily responsible for the creation of the CreativeWork.

While such policies are most typically expressed in natural language, sometimes related information (e.g. indicating a funder) can be expressed using schema.org terminology.

prop.name: sponsor
prop.desc: A person or organization that supports a thing through a pledge, promise, or financial contribution. e.g. a sponsor of a Medical Study or a corporate sponsor of an event.

prop.name: isicV4
prop.desc: The International Standard of Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities (ISIC), Revision 4 code for a particular organization, business person, or place.

prop.name: brand
prop.desc: The brand(s) associated with a product or service, or the brand(s) maintained by an organization or business person.

prop.name: honorificSuffix
prop.desc: An honorific suffix preceding a Person's name such as M.D. /PhD/MSCSW.

prop.name: vatID
prop.desc: The Value-added Tax ID of the organization or person.

prop.name: nationality
prop.desc: Nationality of the person.

prop.name: faxNumber
prop.desc: The fax number.

prop.name: relatedTo
prop.desc: The most generic familial relation.

prop.name: follows
prop.desc: The most generic uni-directional social relation.

prop.name: knows
prop.desc: The most generic bi-directional social/work relation.

prop.name: worksFor
prop.desc: Organizations that the person works for.

Thing.name: sameAs
Thing.desc: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Wikidata entry, or official website.

Thing.name: image
Thing.desc: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.

Thing.name: additionalType
Thing.desc: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

Thing.name: identifier
Thing.desc: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing, such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links. See background notes for more details.

Thing.name: potentialAction
Thing.desc: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.

Thing.name: mainEntityOfPage
Thing.desc: Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described. See background notes for details.

Thing.name: disambiguatingDescription
Thing.desc: A sub property of description. A short description of the item used to disambiguate from other, similar items. Information from other properties (in particular, name) may be necessary for the description to be useful for disambiguation.
